item.title: Madden 26 Soundtrack Features Chappell Roan, DMX, Green Day, and More
item.content:encoded:
With Madden 26’s release here, EA Sports has revealed the full soundtrack for the upcoming game.

Featured artists in this year’s game includes Blur, Bush, Lil Nas X, Shaboozey, Twenty One Pilots, DMX, Chappel Roan, Green Day, and more. And rather than a list of current tracks from the artists, the song listing features a mix of songs both new and old.

In addition to a list of dozens of songs, there are a few songs that are exclusive as snippets within stadiums. You can check out the full list songs below. If you want to listen to it now, EA Sports put together a playlist via Apple Music.

What tracks stand out to you most in Madden 26? Let us know in the comments, and take the discussion further in the official Insider Gaming forums.

Madden 26 Soundtrack

DICE Clarifies How Bots Work In Battlefield 6 Beta

With the Battlefield 6 beta starting, DICE has clarified how AI bots will work and appear in matches for the time being.

Asus ROG Xbox Ally X Release Date Has Been Revealed

According to a known data miner, the release date for the Asus ROG Xbox Ally and Xbox Ally X has been found to be in October.

Xbox Insiders Now Have Access to Gaming Copilot Beta

Gaming Copilot (beta) is available now for Xbox Insiders on PC and Windows handhelds. Here are more details.

Sony Admits Its Live Service Games Shift Isn’t Going “Smoothly”

During its latest earnings call, Sony’s CFO admitted that the company’s recent shift to live service games hasn’t been going all that well.

item.title: DICE Clarifies How Bots Work In Battlefield 6 Beta
item.content:encoded:
When Battlefield 6 launches, it’s expected that AI bots will be used to fill out matches should there not be enough players. In the Battlefield 6 Open Beta, however, AI bots won’t be everywhere.

In a post on social media, the official Battlefield 6 communications team clarified how bots, or “AI soldiers” will work during the game’s beta.

“AI Soldiers are only present on the “Training Grounds” playlists within the Open Beta,” the team said. “This week is ‘Breakthrough Initiation’.

“Breakthrough Initiation is a playlist that allows you to experience Breakthrough alongside 15 other players, with additional AI Soldiers filling up the match thereafter.”

DICE says that Training Grounds playlists are available to “introduce people to the core elements of Breakthrough, and offer a smoother experience than a full lobby.”

“Additionally, you can experience Breakthrough without AI Soldiers by playing Breakthrough from the “Featured” playlist row,” they added. “Training Grounds is only available for the first 15 ranks, at which point it will disappear from the front end.”

Currently, Battlefield 6’s Beta is being filled by hundreds of thousands of players ahead of the official start of the “open” portion on August 9. If players were worried about bots being a part of traditional matches, it appears that won’t be the case.

As mentioned, however, the game is expected to use bots to fill up lobbies should there not be enough players for a match. They can also be used, as DICE’s Jac Carlsson said, when creating a custom game mode in Portal that allows players to practice and improve at the game.

Are you playing the Battlefield 6 beta this weekend or next? Let us know down below, and take the discussion further in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the leaked release date for the Asus ROG Xbox Ally and Xbox Ally X. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Xbox Insiders Now Have Access to Gaming Copilot Beta
item.content:encoded:
Starting today, Xbox Insiders who have enrolled in the PC Gaming Preview will find Gaming Copilot (beta) in the Game Bar for Windows PCs.

Gaming Copilot is a feature that helps players reach gameplay faster, sharpens their skills, and guides them through obstacles. The early beta version was previously available through the Xbox Mobile app, enabling players to access Copilot on a second screen. Now, select players have received an even more integrated experience.

Xbox Gaming Copilot Beta Features

The Gaming Copilot beta will track the player’s Xbox activity “to provide an experience centred around you”. Players can ask for help with the game they are playing, or with games they are interested in or want to discover. Additionally, you can also ask questions about your account, play history and achievements.

The Gaming Copilot widgets can be pinned to the screen and used through Voice mode. This mode allows players to use the feature while actively playing the game. Players can ask for tips or any other help without stopping the gameplay. All they need to do is select the ‘Microphone’ option in the Gaming Copilot widget, and the conversation can be continued seamlessly whenever the player is stuck.

Moreover, when the Xbox Insider asks Gaming Copilot for help during voice mode, it will take screenshots of the player’s gameplay to provide more helpful responses. This allows players to refer to events in the game as they occur, without needing a detailed description.

The Gaming Copilot (beta) is also available on Windows Handhelds for Xbox Insiders, albeit with limited functionality. The early preview is currently available only to Insiders in select regions. You can check out the complete list here.

In other news, a recent Xbox update added cross-device play history for insiders. Also, check out the Game Pass titles for August 2025 Wave 1. What are your thoughts on Xbox’s Gaming Copilot beta? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Fallout 4 getting a paid mods system. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.
